page.title: 19POYNTON COUNCIL OF CHURCHES
page.content: Mr.Ball,chairman of the Poynton Council of Churches,told us that the councils aim was to show the united face of Christianity in the area.Five denominations,Anglican,Roman Catholic Baptist,Methodist and Pentacostal were represented on the council.Each year there were 4 meetings to discuss common problems,and ways in which the churches could become involved in the life of the community.One church organisation mentioned was'Open Hands' whose members helped the elderly the handicapped and the sick.Recently a shanty had been built in the Civic Hall car park,and for several days people lived in it for 3 to 4 hrs eating rice,and drinking water to show how the worlds poor lived.He said that church in Poynton was well attended.
